snippet: Leaders protest what they see as an insult by Anglophile elites toward traditional Indian culture after a judge and others wearing saronglike dhotis are turned away from a Chennai club.
abstract: Regional leaders in southern India protest after posh English-style cricket club denies entry to several men wearing traditional Indian wraparound garments called dhotis; are casting event as an insult by Anglophile elites toward traditional Indian culture.
lead_paragraph: Leaders protest what they see as an insult by Anglophile elites toward traditional Indian culture after a judge and others wearing saronglike dhotis are turned away from a Chennai club.

headline.main: Indian Club’s Ban on Dhotis in Favor of Western Attire Draws Protests
headline.print_headline: Indian Club Tells Lawyers Traditional Garb Won’t Do; Media Outcry Follows
